alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Kennebec; Sagadahoc; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kennebec, southeastern Oxford, Androscoggin and north central Cumberland Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 451 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Mechanic Falls, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Auburn, Mechanic Falls, Turner, Litchfield, Waterford, Lisbon, Greene, Durham, Bowdoin, Harrison, Leeds, Buckfield, Hebron, Wales, Sabattus, Norway, Poland, Minot, and Oxford. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 73 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near a lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central, western and southwestern Maine.
